comment: A really easy class if you just turn in the assignments. Tbh I just ChatGPT'd the entire class. There's a group project where you basically think of a business idea and go through your process, but it's pretty simple. You do have to do these interviews but I bs'd those too. Not a bad choice for an elective.

Overall a pretty well put together class, basically worked out of one assignment that ended up leading to the final project. Just stay focused on completing the work and you will get a A in this class.
Very easy. Finished the whole class and all assignments within the first 2 weeks of the 4 week course. Very self explanatory and very quick grader. It would be very hard to get less than a B.

rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Very easy class. Assignments are easy, group project is easy, nothing time consuming.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Meek is passionate about teaching and inspiring. Her class was so fun and didn't feel like schoolwork. Take her!

As an entrepreneur (4+ years), I found this class informational and well-structured. Professor Meek was super nice and gave good feedback. The class is easier, but you will learn useful information if you become an entrepreneur or work directly in product development. You will also get more comfortable speaking in front of others. Highly recommend!

I have not taken a class that is as boring as this. It feels very disorganized, especially creating groups for a group project. and I am not learning anything at all. It feels like a middle school leadership course. Attendance is mandatory as well. If you take this course, avoid this professor for one that makes class a little more enjoyable.

This class is so boring and attendance is mandatory, she also uses every second of class time sometimes going out of her way to make sure every second is used, it would be different if you actually learned helpful information but you don't.    The major grades are a group project, and other small assignments.
